subject: Failed to invoke suite():java.lang.VerifyError:
msgSnippet: Using Junit 3.7 with Borland Jbuilder 4 windows NT. I just took a bunch of ObjectStore-specific code out of my main project and placed it into another project,
messageBody:
Using Junit 3.7 with Borland Jbuilder 4 windows NT.

I just took a bunch of ObjectStore-specific code out of my main
project and placed it into another project, so I could access it like
an external library.

Before this, I was able to run the test suites in the swingUI no
problemo. But somehow moving the clases into another project broke
something in junit.

The packagenames of these classes are still the same as they were
before. I read the FAQ about problems people have had with the
swingui testrunner not working when the textui testrunner works
fine... Last week, I had the same problem (classcast exception - with
Objectivity, not ObjectStore) that was described in the FAQ, and so I
made up an exclude.properties file which fixed that problem already.

#
# The list of excluded package paths for the TestCaseClassLoader
#
excluded.0=sun.*
excluded.1=com.sun.*
excluded.2=org.omg.*
excluded.3=javax.*
excluded.4=sunw.*
excluded.5=java.*
excluded.6=com.objy.*
excluded.7=com.archiserve.*
excluded.8=COM.odi.*

But now, when I try to run a test under the swingUI,
I get the following error, printed in the bottom status bar, in red.

Failed to invoke suite():java.lang.VerifyError:
(class:com/archiserve/dal/test/TestOid, method: putObject signature()
V) Incompatible object argument for function call

just fyi, testOid is a test suite in its own right, and I was trying
to run a suite of suites there via TestEverything.

When I try to run TestOid directly, it just hangs when trying to load
the test case.

Clicking the "reload classes every run" doesn't seem to do anything.

But again, all works fine under the textui testrunner.

Any other ideas?
